Description: Lower body sherd (mended from four fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with handle root; white slip, glaze fired orange; interior glazed streaky black with three pairs of added white bands; exterior: trace of undetermined decoration (below handle join) above five wide brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.174. The limited interior decoration may suggest that the chalice was an early piece in the series. British Museum 1888,0601.174 was found within the Sanctuary of Aphrodite. As a joining sherd, this sherd likely comes from the same area.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 252, no. 1b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0412) (phase 2)
